messages.text:
*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=139bbe4a76b5 ***

fix build: updated build scripts

R=golang-dev
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5504078

It worked on my machine... :-(
- gri

On Thu, Dec 22, 2011 at 3:42 PM,  <r@golang.org> wrote:
> LGTM assuming they work
>
> http://codereview.appspot.com/5504078/

> It worked on my machine... :-(

By any chance, do you have a file named src/pkg/runtime/asm_amd64.h in
your machine?

If you do, it'd explain why the cp got into the buildscripts checked
in, and why it works in your machine.

-- 
Gustavo Niemeyer
http://niemeyer.net
http://niemeyer.net/plus
http://niemeyer.net/twitter
http://niemeyer.net/blog

-- I'm not absolutely sure of anything.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

amd64 linux, build break:


# Building go command from bootstrap script.
cp: cannot stat `/home/cw/wk/go/go.hg/src/pkg/runtime/asm_amd64.h': No such file or directory

Yeah, we're all still learning the new build system.

Robert's on it.

On Thu, Dec 22, 2011 at 3:40 PM, <cw@f00f.org> wrote:

> amd64 linux, build break:
>
>
> # Building go command from bootstrap script.
> cp: cannot stat `/home/cw/wk/go/go.hg/src/pkg/**runtime/asm_amd64.h': No
> such file or directory
>
>
> http://codereview.appspot.com/**5504078/<http://codereview.appspot.com/5504078/>
>

subject: code review 5504078: fix build: updated build scripts
